messages: 7bd2e92a2e1e8b989d52826e33d99d8a (17:16): Dorward: is this normal that in firefox title property don't print the entire text ?
7bd2e92a2e1e8b989d52826e33d99d8a (17:16): If text is too long
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (17:18): in the window or actually printed on paper?
7bd2e92a2e1e8b989d52826e33d99d8a (17:20): reisio: on window
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (17:23): AxL: mine prints as much as it can until the end of the window's top bar
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (17:23): probably a setting in your desktop environment
7bd2e92a2e1e8b989d52826e33d99d8a (17:24): reisio: can you tell me the URL you are looking please ?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (17:25): I just typed 'asdf ' about fifty times into a title in a local file
f7a80ebbe1112e0bb56f8c30ada1a7b7 (17:39): morning

4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:40): Hi all, I have this textarea in which users can type in any text.  Some have managed to use special characters like the EURO sign.  I would like to save this character by replacing it with &euro;.  I think the best way is to let javascript translate it.  Any ideas how ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:40): wimpies: Best to let the server handle it. How you do that depends on what environment you are working with there.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:41): wimpies: e.g. use HTML::Entities; my $string = encode_entities($source_data);
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:41): I use PHP
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:41): But why the server ?
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:42): The character they type in is encoded with some value local to the device they use
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:42): so only that device knows the correct translation of some value to the character that it represents
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:42): wimpies: Browsers send form data using the character encoding of the page
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (17:43): Dorward: what about the charset attribute?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:43): webben: AFAIK it generally gets ignored.
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:43): Ah so it replies in server language ... right ?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (17:43): Dorward: typical :(
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:44): wimpies: The encoding that the page came in. (Which isn't "language" and a server can serve resources with different encodings)
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:45): ok, that explains why the character returns properly when the text area is refreshed.
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (17:45): Any clues how I can translate on PHP ?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (17:45): Dorward, hmm IE doesn't seem to ignore it: http://msdn.microsoft.com/workshop/author/dhtml/reference/properties/acceptcharset.asp
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:46): webben: Hmm. Interesting. I don't think I'd trust it set to anything other than the encoding the page was delivered in though. :)
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (17:47): no, probably not a good idea :)
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (17:47): but perhaps a good idea to specify both
90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (17:49): Anyone from the UK here?

90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (17:51): How about notice :)
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:54): How about describing the problem in channel?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:03): sK3llZ, yes
90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (18:05): How do I use .htaccess to block a country?
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (18:05): htaccess: http://www.javascriptkit.com/howto/htaccess.shtml
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:06): sK3llZ: Reliably? You can't. You can ban on ip ranges, and you can get lists of where ip addresses are assigned, but ips move.
90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (18:07): I just tested it on .au
90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (18:07): and my friend on au couldnt get on
90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (18:07): I need a list of all the other countries though
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:14): Dorward hm, google can define in which country you live in to prompt the good google.something so i guess it's all possible
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:15): StaZ[work]: Google guesses. Sometimes it guesses wrong. See my previous comments about using the ip address to identify the country of origon.
90ccebe3a513dcafffef5cbfaa7bb538 (18:18): hm

4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:18): I just added accept-charset='iso-8859-1' to my Form in the hope of getting iso-8859-1 compliant character back to the server but AFAIK it does not change a thing I cannot get PHP to convert the EURO sign to &euro;
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:19): wimpies: ISO-8859-1 doesn't contain a euro sign.
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:19): but I can see it the the textarea ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:20): wimpies: Then it looks like the browser is being naughty :) I suggest switching to UTF-8 or ISO-8859-15
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:21): Is specifying iso-8859-15 in the accept-charset the way to do this ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:22): wimpies: I'd ensure the document was served as such in the first place.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:22): (as well)
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:22): Where to I specify that (in the http headers ? or head or where)
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:22): wimpies: HTTP headers.
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:26): Hmm, I just changed it to -15 and now my euro sign no longer shows up correctly after refreshing ...
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:26): wimpies: Possibly you aren't using -15 then.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:27): (And there is a difference between the server saying "This is in ISO-8859-15" and the document /actually/ being in that encoding)
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:27): i forgot to update the accept-charset in the form after changin page default
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:29): wimpies, you might want to specify it in a meta element too if you haven't already
4aa56337a657506600e016d1b0ceebfb (18:30): no i did not ...
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:33): http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/charset.html#h-5.2.2
383d008cbb2b851d0f99deb50f084c73 (18:50): Hi what is equal to tab in html  ??

c82105d932c29e4680a95eef9f252516 (18:50): When I have a URL with POST variables ... do I need to encode the & in the URL which separates the variables? e.g. http://site/blah?sort=title&rev=1 ... this gives an error on the w3 validator

8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:51): LnX2002: Nothing. There are various things which do the things that tabs are used for in traditional typography, but which you use depends on what you are actually trying to achieve.
383d008cbb2b851d0f99deb50f084c73 (18:51): Dorward : I have found it :&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:51): candyban: Those are GET variables, and yes you do. The validator error message even explicitly states that it applies to ampersands in URLs.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:51): LnX2002: No, that's a horrible hack.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:52): LnX2002: why do you want a tab?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:52): LnX2002: The correct solution depends on what you are actually trying to achieve. Indent the first line of something? Seperate things? etc.
383d008cbb2b851d0f99deb50f084c73 (18:52): To seperate values :D
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (18:52): sepArate
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:52): what sort of values?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:52): LnX2002: Err. Could be a job for a table, but its hard to say without seeing the data.
c82105d932c29e4680a95eef9f252516 (18:52): Doward: thought it ment a file called foo&bar.doc or something
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:52): is this a list? a table of data?
383d008cbb2b851d0f99deb50f084c73 (18:52): I got 2 cols 1 for product 1 for price
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:52): candyban: No.
c82105d932c29e4680a95eef9f252516 (18:52): Doward: k ... I'll fix it then ... thanks :o)
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:52): table
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:53): LnX2002, http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/tables.html
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:53): LnX2002: That's a table then. <tr><th>Product<th>Price <tr><td>ACME rocket skates<td>$2.99
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:53): LnX2002, http://www.webaim.org/techniques/tables/
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:53): LnX2002: http://accessify.com/tools-and-wizards/accessibility-tools/table-builder/
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (18:55): using tables inappropriately for the sake of teaching? :/ http://www.webaim.org/techniques/tables/
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:56): reisio: hmm, yes, but this http://www.webaim.org/techniques/tables/data.php
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (18:56): is a nice approachable presentation of how to markup a table with e.g. scope

8d4ab7bb6ad1e9282d92841dcedb34ad (19:10): hi, I have a question: How can I set the default host for a link in HTML? For example if I have <a href="index.html"> and I save the HTML page to a local file, and click on it, I want it to go to http://somewhere/index.html. I think I've seen this somewhere but don't remember.
7587ddce89cdc9cfccb18796f9517a8f (19:10): www.FileRip.com - Download videos off youtube, myspace, google, putfile!")
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:11): Fawzib: <base>, but avoid it, its implemented a bit inconsistantly, especially when it comes to CSS. If you want an absolute URL, then use an absolute URL.

8d4ab7bb6ad1e9282d92841dcedb34ad (19:12): cool, is just that some hacker added a redirect to a page I'm trying to see, so I want to save locally remove the <meta> tags and still use the site. Thanks for the help.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (19:17): Fawzib: if you just hit ESC a lot, it'll probably cancel out a meta redirect
8d4ab7bb6ad1e9282d92841dcedb34ad (19:24): ok, I'll try that
